Key Match Events: The Phillies ended Game 7 of the 2023 NLCS without a hit in their final 17 plate appearances.
Craig Kimbrel allowed the walk-off run in the ninth inning of NLCS Game 3 and blew a two-run lead in the eighth inning of Game 4.
Aaron Nola was taken deep twice in the second inning of Game 6.
Ranger Suarez was charged for three runs in Game 7.
Nick Castellanos went hitless after going 8-for-15 with five home runs in four games.
Johan Rojas struck out in his final plate appearance of 2023.
Orion Kerkering allowed two singles and a double to tie the game in Game 3 and walked two batters to force in a run in Game 4.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Rob Thomson expressed trust in Craig Kimbrel despite his struggles.
Thomson reflected on the challenges of making pitching decisions and the impact of hindsight.
Thomson acknowledged the importance of giving young players like Johan Rojas and Orion Kerkering playoff experience.
Others: The Phillies' reliance on Craig Kimbrel and the impact of his performance in the NLCS.
The roster construction and the limited use of Taijuan Walker and Michael Lorenzen.
The impact of regression on key players like Aaron Nola, Ranger Suarez, and Nick Castellanos.
The challenges faced by young players Johan Rojas and Orion Kerkering in high-pressure situations.
